lapse.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a short period of time during which you fail to do something well or properly, often caused by not being careful
lapse.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: A defensive lapse by Keown allowed Tottenham to score.
Despite the occasional lapse, this was a fine performance by the young saxophonist.
A single lapse of concentration cost Sampras the game.
After taking the drug, several patients suffered memory lapses  (=when you cannot remember something for a short time).
lapse.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a failure to do something you should do, especially to behave correctly
lapse.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He forgot to offer Darren a drink, but Marie did not appear to notice the lapse.
lapse.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a period of time between two events
lapse.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The usual time lapse between request and delivery is two days.
a lapse of about ten seconds
lapse.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to gradually come to an end or to stop for a period of time
lapse.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if a contract, agreement etc lapses, it comes to an end, usually because an agreed time limit has passed
lapse.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Your booking will automatically lapse unless you confirm it.
lapse.translation[1].definitions[1].note: In everyday English, people usually say that a contract or agreement runs out rather than lapses:
His club membership had run out.
lapse.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to stop believing in or following a religion
lapse.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: those people who have lapsed from the practice of their religion
lapse.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: if a period of time lapses, it passes
lapse.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Many years had lapsed since her first visit to Wexford.
lapse.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: if a contract, agreement, or offer lapses, it ends because an agreed time limit has passed
lapse.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The customer has the right to exercise the option or allow the option to lapse.
There are many films on which the copyright has lapsed and hasn’t been renewed.
lapse.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: if an INSURANCE POLICY lapses, it ends because the regular payments required have not been made
lapse.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: Kimble let his fire insurance lapse when he couldn’t afford the premiums.
lapse.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a period of time between two events
lapse.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: There is a four-day lapse between the time a patron buys a ticket and the money is deposited in the bank.
lapse.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: a failure to do something you should do
lapse.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The customer complained about a lapse in service.
